Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto outshined Carlos Rodon among starters, the latter lasting just 3.1 innings while the Japanese star went for 6.1 and left to a standing ovation
Teoscar Hernandez and Freddie Freeman hit back-to-back homers in the bottom of the third despite facing two outs to give the Dodgers a 4-1 lead entering the seventh
Tommy Edman hit a solo homer to open the scoring in the bottom of the second, but Juan Soto hit his own with two outs in the top of the third
Shohei Ohtani appeared to suffer a left shoulder injury at the end of the seventh inning when he tried to steal second base but landed awkwardly while sliding
With bases loaded and two outs, relief pitcher Alex Vesia entered for the nervy Blake Treinen and threw one pitch to catch pinch hitter Jose Trevino with a pop-fly out, sealing the 4-2 result
Pre-Game Insights: Freddie Freeman is focused on the future, specifically Game 2 and Yankees starter Carlos Rodon after his historic walk-off grand slam in Game 1
The Game 2 pitching matchup featured Dodgers' Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Yankees' Carlos Rodon, both making their World Series debuts
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts said Shohei Ohtani is showing good strength and good range of motion following a shoulder injury
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rapper Ice Cube performed on the Dodger Stadium field ahead of the first pitch for Game 2, sending the sellout crowd of over 53,000 people into a frenzy
The Dodgers have already put up a display honoring Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam in Game 1 of the World Series
